general: This law allows the government to borrow more money from the Contingencies Fund, which is like an emergency savings account, so that they can spend more on things that are important right now. The extra money will only be available for a short time, until the end of 2020.

series.short: "Financial Safety Net Expanded: Temporary Increase in Contingencies Fund"
series.text:
* Simplified point 1: The Contingencies Fund Act 1974 allows for an increase in the capital limit of the fund from 2% to 50%.
* Simplified point 2: This temporary increase is only applicable before 1st April 2021.
* Simplified point 3: The purpose of this act is to provide additional financial resources during times of contingency.

summary: The Contingencies Fund Act 2020 helps ensure that there are enough funds available when unexpected events happen. It temporarily increases the amount of money that can be used from the Contingencies Fund from 2% to 50% until April 1st, 2021. This means that more money will be available to help deal with unexpected situations like natural disasters or economic crises.
single:
* The Contingencies Fund Act 1974 is amended to temporarily increase the maximum capital of the Contingencies Fund from 2% to 50% of the authorized supply expenditure for the year ending on the previous 31st March.
* This modification is effective before 1st April 2021.
* The purpose of this act is to provide additional funding for unforeseen circumstances or emergencies during the financial year 2020-2021.
